intro: Balsamodendrum kafal, commonly known as the Kafal balsam, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Balsamodendrum kafal is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with ample sunlight.
